page.title: 01CHAGFORD, DEVON, ENGLAND
page.content: The town of{Chagford}is situated in the{North Eastern corner of the {Dartmoor National Park. }It is a most attractive town, in a beautiful setting, with much to offer to both residents and visitors. It was granted its{Charter in 1305}and during the {14th Century}became prominent in the {Tin}mining industry, being one of the four{Stannary Towns.} Later on it became important in the{Woollen {Industry}but its main claim to fame nowadays is as a centre for tourists and visitors. Both the wonderful remoteness of{Dartmoor}and many {beaches}are close at hand, with{Exeter half an hour away to the East and {Okehampton}10 miles to the West. A considerable number of professional people retire to this area and with their interests retain its liveliness and wide variety of leisure pursuits.
